one_reviews_text: I bought it a year ago and a few months ago it stopped working, I wrote to Oculus and they told me to write to Insomniac, no one was responsible for the fact that the game does not work, and worst of all is that a game is still on sale that it does not work, like many others for example herobound from rift, the oculus store is a disaster, nobody controls the charge and responsible for all the games on sale to work, we will have to write a joint letter to Mr. Zuckenberg so that know how messy your play store.

review_title: I would have liked to actually play this
one_reviews_text: Purchased the 2 games remaining in the insomniac bundle and have been looking forward to playing this game for more than 1 year now.  It installs properly but won't start - I immediately followed the very clear template-driven guidance to contact Insomniac.  They acted like they didn't know what I was talking about.  After five contacts without resolution, I tried to request a refund (because the game never started) - but too much time had passed waiting for Insomniac..  Oculus has been very  supportive and we're working through the  trouble shooting (even though the other 2 games in the bundle play flawlessly ) - But Insomniac, I followed your tech support popups and instructions to a "t" and sent in my support request form repeatedly.   I wanted to be a raving fan but they have been remarkably unhelpful - Bad show, Insomniac.

i love this game, but I would like a first person mode plz. that way, I will enjoy the game more, and actually feel like i am the character. I mean, it is fun, and cool to play, but... I am not a fan of 3rd person vr games.

So many better games in this genre outside and inside VR (Moss, Hellblade, Chronos) to name a few. I still can't understand why there is no co-op mode in this game. It wouldn't have solved this game's issues but it certainly would have helped. Such a missed opportunity.

review_title: Broken by bad controls and boring camera
one_reviews_text: I just came over here after playing Moss (5*), Hellblade (5*) and Carly and the Reapaerman (5*). This game, while the graphics are really good and the story is okay, does fall flat by having bad camera and gamepad controlls. There are so many jump that I failed, because I couldn't tell the distance of a jump. I also walked quite a few time in the wrong direction as the camera changed and I couldn't tell from where I came.

This is not a bad game, but it's just pretty average. It really doesn't take advantage of VR in any way. You could play this game without VR and you really wouldn't notice much difference, except maybe a better camera. It's just a simple brawler. There's better versions, just look at the Batman series. This pales in comparison. It's just rather mediocre. I stopped playing after less than an hour and don't really want to play again. Maybe if you have small children they will appreciate the simplistic nature of this brawler.
you are the best, thank you for the great games
efgrfrwegh
Simple but very fun!

Sluggish and unsatisfying combat system, bad animations, slow pace and the most boring brawler ever (yeah, it's so fun to be interrupted every minute). The game just feels like a mobile port. I can't believe it was made by the creators of Ratchet & Clank.

Meh, I'm tired of the awkward camera, cheap deaths and unskippable cut-scenes. Wish there was a refund option.
Nice characters and interesting level achievments.

A decent game with a simplistic "lets go beat 'em up" plot and decent combat mechanics. VR is completely unnecessary for this game as you are just an eye in the sky and hop from zone-load to zone-load. Good for the beat 'em up genre, lost for VR as that adds little immersion.
Didn't like it much :(

review_title: A polished game that shouldn't be in VR
one_reviews_text: I purchased Feral Rights at the discounted price and even then I feel like I spent too much. This is a game that really didn't need to be in VR, it would have worked perfectly and would have actually been much more fun outside of VR. I can't recommend this game because of how shallow it feels, the combat system is average and the story is boring.

review_title: From the creators of Ratchet and Clank
one_reviews_text:
This is a AAA game from a AAA developer, and it feels like it. It has a rich story, excellent voice acting. The combat system was well thought out and very fun. Ripping an enemy in half never seems to get old. The action is fast paced, and the control is tight.

On the down side, it is somewhat short. It takes about 8 to 10 hours to complete. A speed run might take a couple hours. There are side missions, but not many. 

Ultimately, it's a solid game that feels just a little incomplete, but that's largely because we are used to games having a wider scope and longer play time. While Feral Rites doesn't rise the the same level of perfection as Ratchet and Clank, Insomiac's voyage into VR proves that that the genera can be directly ported.  This game is absolutely worth your time.  Get it!
A polished game where you go from fight to fight, plus the occasional upgrade. Beautiful graphics, fun to play.
This came could be so much better with a dynamic camera system like Lucky's Tale for example

review_title: I can tell work went into it...
one_reviews_text: I hate to not like this game.  But it just wasn't fun.  I have played a lot of games in the genre, like the God of War series, and this sir is no God of War.  Meh art-style, with terribly clashing choice of music, and an annoying camera system forced me to put it down after an hour.

review_title: A simplistic brawler, but immersive fun.
one_reviews_text: Beautifully created worlds with a stylized comic tone. Brutal executions, cool combos, and just a polished experience. A very optimized game that got a bad wrap.

So this game came out at a higher price point. And it wasn't worth that price, so Insomniac lowered it, giving early adopters several free games as a thank you.

At it's current price point this game is excellent for fans of brawlers. The camera system can be a little disorienting but the guide feature will keep you moving in the right direction and compensates nicely.

Don't let the early low reviews turn you off. This game has a lot to offer to fans of the genre. Well worth the current price!
I got the game while it was on sale for 10 dollars and just completed it. Really captivating game. Highly recommend it.
